conclusion: Analyze the motion of the negatively charged particle in both the electric and magnetic fields.
The particle moves in a straight line through the electric field between the plates MN and PQ.
Electric force balances the magnetic force acting on the particle.
Electric field E between the plates creates an electric force F_E = qE on the particle.
Magnetic field B creates a magnetic force F_B = qvB perpendicular to the velocity v.
For the particle to move in a straight line, qE = qvB, hence E = vB.
After exiting the electric field, the particle enters the magnetic field and moves in a circular path due to the magnetic force.
Radius R of the circular path is determined using qvB = mv^2/R, hence R = mv/(qB).
The particle just fails to exit the magnetic field from side cd, meaning the maximum horizontal travel distance is 2L.
Horizontal distance traveled in the magnetic field equals the diameter of the circular path, 2R = 2L, hence R = L.
Substituting R = L into the radius equation gives L = mv/(qB), hence v = qBL/m.
The magnitude of the velocity of the particle when shot into point S is v = qBL/m.
